Package chess

Class Board

java.lang.Object
chess.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
The Board class represents a 2D chess Board, storing it's state via an 8 by 8 grid of Piece instances, and an 8 by 8 string visual display. Provides movePiece and render for the Chess class to orchestrate with. Provides helper methods for the Pieces to conduct move-legality verification with.
Author:
Patrick Barry, Philip Murray
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • layout

      public Piece[][] layout
      Stores the representation of the grid of a chess Board as an 8 by 8 Piece double-array. The first index corresponds to the File (or the ith or y-position) The second index corresponds to the Rank (or the jth or x-position)

    • stringBoard

      public java.lang.String[][] stringBoard
      Stores a visual representation of the grid of a chess Board as an 8 by 8 ASCII double-array Rendered from the Board.render method from Board.layout

    • state

      public int state
      State of the chess game: In Game: -1, White Wins: 0, Black Wins: 1, Draw: 2

    • gameItteration

      public int gameItteration
      Number of turns that have been played. Diverges from the Chess.gameItteration by 1 when testing possible moves in Check detection methods

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructor of the Board class. Returns a new chess Board with a new set of chess pieces in their initial positions.

  • Method Details

    • getCopy

      public Board getCopy()
      Creates a copy of this board via serialization. Used when testing if moving a piece results in or maintains a checked state.
      Returns:
      Returns a copy of the current board

    • EnemyCanAttack

      public boolean EnemyCanAttack​(int s, Position p)
      This method determines if the enemy side can capture at a specific position on the Board. Used to inspect the two spaces which the King travels when castling. For each piece of the side s's opponent, it is tested if it can be called to move to position p. If such piece exists, this method returns true.
      Parameters:
      s - The side (0: white, 1: black) in question
      p - The position that the opponent of side s may capture
      Returns:
      true if the opponent of side s can capture at position p. false - If the opponent cannot capture at position p.

    • KingIsChecked

      public boolean KingIsChecked​(int s)
      This method determines if the King of side s is checked. For each piece of the side s's opponent, it is tested if it can be called to move to the King's piece. If such piece exists, this method returns true.
      Parameters:
      s - The side (0: white, 1: black) of the King
      Returns:
      true if the opponent of side s can capture at the s's King. false - If the opponent cannot capture the King.

    • KingCanRecover

      public boolean KingCanRecover​(int s)
      This method determines if side s's King can recover from a Checked state. For every piece the King has, for every spot on the board, the movePiece method is called to move the Piece to that spot. If there exists a valid move (no IllegalMoveException is thrown by the movePiece method), then this method returns true.
      Parameters:
      s - The side (0: white, 1: black) of the King
      Returns:
      true if side s is in Checkmate state. false - if side s is in Checkmate state.

    • movePiece

      public int movePiece​(Position p, Position np, Piece prom, int s) throws IllegalMoveException
      This method is responsible enacting a player's move by calling for the piece at position p to move to position np. It conducts some initial legality checks, then it clones this instance of chess Board, requests for the piece to move from p to np. The piece may throw an IllegalMoveException. After the piece is moved, the piece's King is checked to not be in a Checked state. An IllegalMoveException is thrown if the King is found to be in a Checked state. The piece's moves are then applied to this instance of the Board. KingIsChecked is called to determine if the opponent's King is now Checked. If opponent is Checked, KingCanRecover is called to determine if the opponent is in a Checkmate state. If opponent in Checkmate, this instance of the Board's state is set to the winning side's team ID (0 or 1).
      Parameters:
      p - Position of a player's piece
      np - Position the player is attempting to move their piece to
      prom - Piece that is the optional promotion parameter for Pawn cases
      s - The side (0: white, 1: black) of the player
      Returns:
      0 If the player's opponent is not Checked. 1 - the opponent's player is Checked. 2 - the opponent's player is in a Checkmate state.
      Throws:
      IllegalMoveException - No piece located at p
      IllegalMoveException - Piece at p is not from current team
      IllegalMoveException - Move cannot be done, King is (or still is) checked

    • updatePos

      void updatePos()
      This method is responsible for updating the position of each Piece on this Board after the moveTo method is called. This ensures that the internal Position of the Piece moved always matches the indexical position of this Board's layout which references it.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece​(Position p)
      Responsible for updating the position member of each Piece after the moveTo method is called, to match that of this Board's Piece layout. This ensures that the internal Position of the Piece moved is always updated.
      Parameters:
      p - Positional index of this Board's layout.
      Returns:
      Updated Piece

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece​(Position p, Piece pic)
      Responsible for setting the setting the positional index p of this Board's layout to be a reference to Piece pic.
      Parameters:
      p - Positional index of this Board's layout.
      pic - Piece of this method updates this Board's layout at p to reference.

    • noCollisions

      public boolean noCollisions​(Position p1, Position p2)
      Determines if there are no pieces located between two linearly separated positions on the board.
      Parameters:
      p1 - Start position on this Board.
      p2 - End position on this Board.
      Returns:
      true - If no collisions exist. false - If collisions exist.

    • render

      void render()
      Prints this board as an ASCII representation in the console
